quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello. Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s up, buddy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is not funny. Why is my stuff in here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that’s weird. Oh, dollar for a stapler, that’s pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, well, I’m not paying for my own stuff, okay? I know you did this, because you’re friends with the vending machine guy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who, Steve?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, Steve, whatever his name is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry. What do I want? What do I want… Oh, it’s a pencil cup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no. That’s my pencil cup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I don’t think so, I just bought it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, I think so, and you’re going to hand it over to me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love these.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, fine. Where’s my wallet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, there it is. J1.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But I don’t have any…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here, you know what? You can have some nickels.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [putting quarters in] Five, ten, fifteen, twenty, twenty-five…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Where are we going this afternoon?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! Ha ha ha!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Last week, Michael sent out this mysterious memo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: “It’s time for our first quarter camaraderie event, so pack a swimsuit, a toothbrush, rubber-soled shoes, and a ski mask.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A ski mask and a swimsuit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So that he can have us rob a bank, and then escape through the sewers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And brush our teeth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley! Bo banley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I need to know…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Banana fana fo fanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What we’re doing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Be my mo manley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You said bring a toothbrush.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is this an overnight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe. The suspense is just so exciting, isn’t it?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Should my wife tell her boss she’s not coming in tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe, I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Not maybe. Yes or no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, no. But… okay, don’t spoil it for everybody, all right? But we are going on a booze cruise on Lake Wallenpaupack.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: In January?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s cheaper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is not just another party. This is a leadership training exercise. Right? I’m going to combine elements of fun and motivation and education into a single mind-blowing experience.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is now time to unveil the destination of this year’s retreat. We are going on a harbor cruise of Lake Wallenpaupack. It’s a booze cruise!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I have a test for business school tomorrow night. Is it okay if I skip the cruise and study for that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. This is mandatory. But don’t worry, you know what? You’re gonna learn plenty. This is gonna turn your life around, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m already in business school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, this…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wait, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why did you tell us to bring a bathing suit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To throw you off the scent.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, but I bought a bathing suit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, just keep the tags on and you can return it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I took the tags off already.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that’s not my fault, okay? Just.. we’re not going to pay for a bathing suit. Okay, I know what you’re all thinking, “Who is this smart little cookie?” Her name is Brenda… something, and she is from corporate. And she is here, like you, to learn from what I have to say.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am a great motivational speaker. I attended a Tony Robbins event by the airport last year, and… it wasn’t the actual course. You have to pay for the actual course. But it talked about the actual course. And I’ve incorporated a lot of his ideas into my own course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Leader… ship. The word “ship” is hidden inside the word “leadership,” as its derivation. So if this office is, in fact, a ship, as its leader, I am the captain. But we’re all in the same boat. Teamwork!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Last year, Michael’s theme was “Bowl over the Competition!” So guess where we went.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now, on this ship that is the office, what is a sales department? Anyone?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How about the sales department is the sails?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Darryl, the sales department makes sales. Good. Let me just explain. I see the sales department as the furnace.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: A furnace?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeesh, how old is this ship?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about the anchor?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What does the furnace do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, let’s not get hung up on the furnace. This just… it’s the sales… I see the sales department down there. They’re in the engine room, and they are shoveling coal into the furnace, right? I mean, who saw the movie Titanic? They were very important in the movie Titanic. Who saw it? Show of hands!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m not really sure what movie you’re talking about. Are you sure you got the title right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Titanic?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think you’re thinking of The Hunt for Red October.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m Leo DiCaprio! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael stands in the front of the boat and says that he’s king of the world within the first hour, or I give you my next paycheck.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, everyone in the engine room drowned.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! Thank you, spoiler alert. You saw the movie, those of you who did. They’re happy down there in the furnace room. And they’re dirty and grimy and sweaty, and they’re singing their ethnic songs, and… actually, that might be warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The… no, no. No, I didn’t… okay. Well, okay, in a nutshell, what I’m saying is… leadership. We’ll talk more about that on the boat. Ship.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aye aye, Captain.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] A three-hour tour, a three-hour tour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, you are Mary Ann! We have the Professor and Ginger, welcome aboard. Angela, you are Mrs. Howell. Lovey. [to Kelly] Uh… the native. Sometimes they come from neighboring… [to Stanley] We have one of the Globetrotters, I am the Skipper, and Dwight, you will be Gilligan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Actually, I’m the Skipper. But you can be Gilligan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’d rather die. Hi, I am Michael Scott, I am the captain of this party.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: I am Captain Jack, I am captain of the ship. I’m also captain of anyone who sets foot on the ship. [to boarding passengers] Hi, welcome aboard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In an office, when you are ranking people, manager is higher than captain. On a boat, who knows? It’s nebulose.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, look! I’m king of the world!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay, all right! Welcome aboard! I am your captain, Captain Jack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Michael Scott. Welcome, welcome!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay! So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! So…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Please. The life preservers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: They are located underneath the seats, all along the border of the boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But don’t worry, you are not going to be needing life preservers tonight.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Well, we might, okay? Please let me finish, okay? Thank you. So, the Coast Guard requires that I tell you where the safety exits are. On this ship, it’s very easy. Anywhere over the side. [Dwight laughs loudly.] Not only am I your ship captain, I am also your party captain! Whoo! We’re gonna get it going in just a few minutes here…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m your party captain too! And you are gonna put on your dancing shoes later on! So we are gonna…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay, Michael, if you don’t mind…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rock it!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Please, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If the boat’s a-rockin’, don’t come knockin’!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Your company’s employees are not the only people on the boat tonight, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re all gonna have a good time tonight!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Why don’t you let me and my crew do our job. You just sit back and have a good time. All right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hm? Okay. Yep.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You guys, it’s like we’re in high school and we’re at the cool table. Right?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Pam, were you a cheerleader?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, she was totally Miss Artsy-Fartsy in high school. She wore the turtleneck and everything!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: That’s hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s not hilarious, but…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Where did you go to school?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Bishop O’Hara.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Piss slop who cares-a? We played you! You… you really look familiar. Did you… you cheered for them, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, no.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Yes, I did! [chanting] A-W-E-S-O-M-E! Awesome! Awesome is what we are! We’re the football superstars! A-W-E-S-O-M-E!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I remember that! We crushed you like 42-10!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Having fun?

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Yeah. Everybody’s really nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Well, that is what Scranton is all about. Not like you New Yawkers.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: When are you going to start the presentation?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we already sort of started it back at the office and on the dock with the Gilligan thing, so… right now, I was thinking. Yes. Okay, listen up all you Dunder-Mifflinites! I would like to talk to you all about life preservers. Now, one important life preserver in business is IT support.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Not now, Mike, we’re doing the limbo! That’s right, partiers, it’s time to limbo, limbo, limbo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Limbo, whoo!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: All right! I need a volunteer to come up here and hold my stick. Who’s it gonna be?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Me.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Me! Me, me, me.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Uh… usually it’s a woman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m stronger.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Hey, I got an idea! How would you like to steer the ship, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Keep us on a steady course. Keep a sharp eye out. I’m counting on you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was the youngest pilot in Pan Am history. When I was four, the pilot let me ride in the cockpit and fly the plane with him. And I was four. And I was great. And I would have landed it, but my dad wanted us to go back to our seats.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: All right, all right, that was great! Now it’s time for the dance contest!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But before that, I have to do my presentation.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Nope! Dance contest!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, we’ll have a motivational dance contest! Hit it! Yeah, okay, dancing! It is a primal art form used in ancient times to express yourself with the body and communicate!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sometimes you have to take a break from being the kind of boss that’s always trying to teach people things. Sometimes you have to just be the boss of dancing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor early in the morning?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey, come inside and talk to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t. Do you want us to run aground, woman?!

quotes.speaker: Darryl and Katy
quotes.text: [chanting] Snorkel shot! Snorkel shot!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Whoo! Who’s next? Come on, Pam! Come on! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I’m not going to do that.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That’s what I’m talking about!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, why don’t we find like a quieter place to hang out?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I’ve just gotta wait for Darryl to do his shot. Just a minute. Come on! [chanting] Darryl! Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s getting kind of rowdy down there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. [chanting] Darryl! Darryl! Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes I just don’t get Roy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, I don’t know. So… what’s it like dating a cheerleader?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um… [A long silence.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m cold.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: So, what’s this presentation all about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! See, this is of general interest. It is about priorities and making decisions, using the boat as an analogy. What is important to you? If the boat is sinking, what do you save?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Women and children.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. Salesmen and profit centers.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: That’s a stupid analogy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, obviously you don’t know anything about leadership.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Well, I was the captain of a PC-1 Cyclone Coastal Patrol Boat during Desert Storm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow. You should be the motivational speaker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. He gives me real responsibility, Michael. Captain Jack delegates. He’s let me steer the ship for the last hour.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’d like to be engaged. How did you manage to pull that off?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, I’ve been engaged for three years, and there’s no end in sight. So… you don’t wanna ask my advice.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Suppose your office building’s on fire. Jim, who would you save?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… let’s see, uh…  The customer. Because the customer is king.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not what I was looking for, but a good thought.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: He’s just sucking up!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: When you were in the Navy, did you ever almost die?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Oh yeah, oh yeah. And I wasn’t thinking about some customer. I was thinking about my first wife. The day I got back on shore, I married her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? I would save the receptionist. I just wanted to clear that up.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hello, everybody, could I have your attention for just a second? Could you listen to me for a second? We were up at the front, and we were talking about what’s really important, and… Pam, I think enough is enough. I think we should set a date for our wedding. How about June 10th? Come on, let’s do it! Come on, Pam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t want to take credit for this, but Roy and I were just having a conversation about making commitments and making choices. Right? Did I motivate you?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, it was Captain Jack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… could have been either one of us, because we were pretty much saying the same thing.  Congratulations. That is great!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: We gotta celebrate! Hey, I got an idea, I got an idea. I can marry you right now, as captain of the ship!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! I can marry you as regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, I want my mom and dad to be there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Then I’ll give you away!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Do you think that’ll ever be us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? Why did you even bring me here tonight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know. Let’s break up.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Whoa. What?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: This is where Captain Jack drives the boat.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seasick? Captain Jack says you should look at the Moon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Captain Jack is a fart face. I’m on medication.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Really? What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Vomicillin. Okay. All right. It’s time to be boss. It’s time to motivate. Let’s blow some minds here. Okay, guys, guys, cool it. Everybody, Dunder-Mifflin Scranton employees, Brenda, I have some very, very urgent news I need to tell everybody right now. Listen up. The ship is sinking! Okay? We’re going down, right now. Just wrap your heads around the reality of that. Shh, please! Everybody, it’s my turn now, okay? Captain Jack is gone. In five minutes, this ship is going to be at the bottom of the lake! And there aren’t enough spaces on the lifeboat! Who are we gonna save? Do we save sales? Do we save customer service? Do we save accounting? This is a business scenario. Right? It’s a scary… it’s a…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Hey! Hey! What the hell is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a predicament, and it’s something that each and every one of us has to think about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m in the brig. See? The boat’s not as corporate-friendly as advertised. What was the deal with the guy jumping overboard? What was… if he had just waited and heard what I had to say, he would be motivated right now and not all wet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is somebody there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What happened to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Captain Jack has a problem with authority.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, right, because you announced that his ship was sinking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He just totally lost it. If you ask me, he caused the panic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What a night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s nice for you. Your friend got engaged.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She was always engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Roy said the first one didn’t count.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s… great. You know, to tell the truth, I used to have a big thing for Pam, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? You’re kidding me. You and Pam? Wow. I would have never have put you two together. You really hid it well. God! I usually have a radar for stuff like that. You know, I made out with Jan…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah? Yep. Well, Pam is cute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. She’s really funny, and she’s warm. And she’s just… well, anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, if you like her so much, don’t give up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She’s engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: BFD. Engaged ain’t married.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never, ever, ever give up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t worry, Michael. I’m taking us to shore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a fake wheel, dummy.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you all packed?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes, I brought my duffel bag and a sleeping bag.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Where do you guys think we’re going?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Definitely some place you can swim.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Maybe Florida.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Did you hear something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knocking] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Can we come in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course, yeah, yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, every man’s dream.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, really? A surprise visit from his boss?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two ladies at once. What? Why are you looking at me like that? Okay, you heard something. Um, yeah, it’s a booze cruise, but it… There’s more to the story than that. It…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: A booze cruise? What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Leadership off-site. Uh, booze cruise is just a rhyme…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, we discussed the IRS’s regulations.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I don’t even know why I said booze cruise. I don’t even think there’s booze on the boat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, this event has to have legitimate business content to be tax deductible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We discussed that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course, of course. Yes. Yes. Look, I have a whole program planned. Jan, this program is going to change people’s lives. I am going to be dropping serious knowledge all over the boat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good. This is Brenda Matlow from corporate training.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought she could attend tonight, and if your event is appropriate, you could give it to other branches.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, cool. Cool. And maybe you could attend tonight and then you could stay over at my house for the night. Awkward. That’s… You know what. Brenda, could Jan and I have a moment alone?

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Jan said if you asked me that I was supposed to say no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? You seriously said that? Okay. Brenda, could Jan and I have a moment alone?

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Sure…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: I mean, no.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, you know, I’m gonna go now, and…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good luck, Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll see you later.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, see you later. And try to be professional.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll call you later.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, that’s all right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s like…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You call me if you need anything, Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll call you, too. [to Brenda] So. You are probably gonna get carded, so I can make you a fake ID. We have a laminating machine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is a sales department? Oscar, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don’t know what the categories are of workers on a boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not giving you the answer. Deck hands is one. And…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, oh, can I be the first mate?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m first mate. You’re second mate. I’m first mate, as the captain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about the anchor?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, the anchor is the only thing that kind of slows the ship down. Toby is the anchor. Oh, God. He, well… [to Brenda] Tell you about Toby later, he’s awful.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Yeah, I know Toby from Jan’s birthday.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Toby. So… It’s an analogy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Toby running to get on the cruise] Hey! What’s wrong with you? You missed the boat.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I got lost.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: We can go back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. That’s his punishment for not being here on time. Too bad, anchor!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I guess I shouldn’t have stopped for dinner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On the high seas, Captain Jack is the leader. On the land it’s Michael. On the ramp up to the boat, I was a bit conflicted. But now that I’m here, I’ll follow Captain Jack to hell and back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Captain Jack, what kind of fish they got in this lake?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Perch, bass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, my grandfather told me there was a monster here that eats Catholics. Have you heard…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: I haven’t heard that, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If the hull is breached for any reason or the boat is overtaken, I am a volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy, and you can count on me.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: That’s good to know, Dwight. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your problem now, Captain Jack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. You know what the best way of studying is?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: At home, not on a boat?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Flash cards.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Flash cards. Doesn’t really help me right now because I’m on a boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are gonna get seasick if you keep reading in here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Yeah! All right. All right. That was awesome. All right, looks like the guitar player’s gonna take a little break. So this’d be a great time to head on over to the taco bar. All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a great way to kill this party. Not on my watch. Let’s, uh,… Let’s rock. Let’s rock some stuff here, okay? [playing badly] Okay… I’m hearing a little too much reverb. [feedback echoing] Can we down the reverb? All right. Follow my lead. [playing Smoke on the Water] Does you guys know that? Take the bass. Take the drums. What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Do you want me to give it a shot? Just…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? I don’t think it’s in…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s not in tune. I don’t know if you can…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don’t know, let’s try.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …make much of out of it, Creed. Good luck to you. I don’t know. It is a defective ax, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Guys, E, blues. Follow me, okay? [playing well]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Back in the ’60s, I was with the Grass Roots. We toured with Janis Joplin, The Doors, Cream. We had a lot of fun, And now I do quality assurance for a paper company. As you can imagine, drugs played a part. They still do. My work calls last about 90 seconds, and that’s about as long as I can concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those slide moves are just bush league. I hope I die before I’m old.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [throwing up]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [speaking Spanish] Por favor, tequila seoor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think you’ve had enough.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What you say, bitch? You know, you might be right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’ve been to the lake before?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yes, I have. [kisses Pam]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Should have done it a long time ago.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, you should have.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I do what’s right whenever I figure it out. I love you, babe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You should make a toast.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I really don’t want to.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Jim, come on, don’t be shy.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Everybody, everybody? There is a toast. Come on…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! Toast!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Yeah, toast! Toast! Toast!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, Katy. Um, didn’t really prepare anything to say. We’re all caught pretty unprepared with this whirlwind courtship. I guess I just wanna say that Pam is the greatest. My best friend. And she’s awesome. And…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay. My turn, my turn. Is this thing on? Uh, I want to congratulate the happy couple. You know, they say that marriage is an institution. And I say, who wants to be in an institution?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s my line! That’s my line, That’s… I always say that at weddings. So I’ll just think of something else to say. I… [band starts playing]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Jim. You got a hat?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [to Angela] So this is…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [storms out of Michael’s office] Well, we’re not going to Florida.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh. Someplace with a pool, then?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [gives Phyllis a look]
